result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian J. Reilly #638890 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
COSTS PAID IN FULL. BALANCE RETURNED TO SURETY. 

  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample by CALLING the Winnebago County Jail, Work Release Unit, WITHIN 72 HOURS, to set up an appointment during the hours of 8:00 a.m. - 4:00. p.m. Monday through Friday, at 920-232-1915 or 920-232-1919.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.
No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.  No intoxicants.
Expungement upon successful completion of sentence/probation.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.  Defendant shall Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  Defendant shall Submit to Random Urinalysis.  Submit DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Credit as listed below.

superMiscConds.notes: No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia. No intoxicants.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.  Defendant shall Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  Defendant shall Submit to Random Urinalysis.  Submit DNA sample if not previously provided.

supervisions.notes: PSI previously waived.  Costs previously paid in full.
